definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: I twisted round and went to slam on the brakes, but in my confusion hit the accelerator a second time.
sentences.chinese: 我扭過身，猛地踩剎車，但是混亂中我又踩了油門。

sentences.english: The enormous fish snapped the line.
The mob fell on the killers and clubbed them to death.
sentences.chinese: 亂民兇猛地攻擊殺人者，把他們亂棍打死了。

sentences.english: He threatens to kill Kimberly, and Jack hangs up abruptly.
sentences.chinese: 他威脅要殺了金伯利，傑克卻猛地掛斷了電話。

sentences.english: The result has been a rapid increase in heart surgery.
sentences.chinese: 其結果就使對心臟實行外科手術的病例迅猛地在增強。

sentences.english: Suddenly he scooted out of the room.
Suddenly I slowed, stopped and stared at the lawn.
sentences.chinese: 我猛地放慢了速度，停下車注視着草坪。

sentences.english: She hoicked out the door and ran away.
The knife was stuck but she pulled it out with a jerk.
sentences.chinese: 刀子被卡住了，她猛地一拔，把它拔了出來。

sentences.english: He horsed me into his office.
sentences.chinese: 他把我猛地拉進了他的辦公室。

sentences.english: A pang of fear shot through my heart.
sentences.chinese: 一陣恐懼猛地襲上了我的心頭。

sentences.english: As they neared the door it was flung open, and Mr.
sentences.chinese: 他們走到門口時，大門猛地打開，裏面走出蟾蜍先生。

sentences.english: Campana slammed on the train's brake and blasted his air horn.
sentences.chinese: 坎帕納猛地扳動火車剎車，拉響了警報器。

sentences.english: He swung the car to the left and that swerve saved Malone's life.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地將車頭轉向左邊，這才保住了馬隆的性命。

sentences.english: I plucked him off and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 我猛地把他扯開，逃走了。

sentences.english: He carefully jerked a big fish out of water.
sentences.chinese: 他小心翼翼地將一條大魚猛地拉出水面。

definition: to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
wide and open/a flash of understanding
